subject: Economics
title: Creative Destruction: Innovation's Brutal Engine
description: A 60-second lesson on Creative Destruction: Innovation's Brutal Engine.

hook.text: Kodak invented the digital camera in 1975, then buried it to protect film sales.

buildup.text: Joseph Schumpeter coined 'creative destruction': new innovations destroy old industries. Cars replaced horses.

twist.text: The destruction is real. Blockbuster employed 84,000 people. Netflix employs 13,000 and serves 100x more customers.

climax.text: Creative destruction is simultaneously capitalism's greatest feature and its cruelest.

punchline.text: Progress means building the future on the rubble of someone's career.

quiz.question: What happened when Kodak invented the digital camera in 1975?
options: They suppressed it to protect film profits and eventually went bankrupt when others commercialized digital photography
Digital cameras failed in the market
